title: New here
content:
im currently a student planning on majoring in graphic design. although i havent taken any typography classes i want a head start. so can you guys give me a little info about it? for example, whats the best programs to use? and anything else that you think would be helpful.   
   
thanks.
author: junex

comments.content:
Hey June,   
   
I think the best you can do is read some books on the subject.   
There are some wonderful specimens out there.   
   
_Elements of Typographic Style_ by **Robert Bringhurst** is the first that comes to my mind.   
   
Amazon link:   
 [http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0881791326/qid=1076442246//ref=sr\_8\_xs\_ap\_i1\_xgl14/104-0860516-9368748?v=glance&s=books&n=507846](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110135805/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/tg/detail/-/0881791326/qid=1076442246/ref=sr_8_xs_ap_i1_xgl14/104-0860516-9368748?v=glance&s=books&n=507846)   
I think it's a very nice introduction to the wonderful and weird world of typography.   
   
Also, a large number of outstanding typographic books can be find on this site too; see:   
 [http://www.typophile.com/books/archives/1%20Essentials.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110135805/http:/www.typophile.com/books/archives/1%20Essentials.html)   
   
Oh, and don't start too early with those pesky computers... There are some nice "manual" ways to start a typography student's career...
